amendment.description: Amendment sought to provide $10 million for Weapons and Munitions Technology (0602624A), $10 million for Innovative Naval Prototypes (INP) Applied Research (0602792N), and $20 million for Innovative Naval Prototypes Advanced Technology Development (0603801N) that would have been used for accelerated development and prototyping for the electromagnetic railgun.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 9 printed in Part A of House Report 115-783 to provide $10 million for Weapons and Munitions Technology (0602624A), $10 million for Innovative Naval Prototypes (INP) Applied Research (0602792N), and $20 million for Innovative Naval Prototypes Advanced Technology Development (0603801N) to be used for accelerated development and prototyping for the electromagnetic railgun.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Langevin amendment Failed by recorded vote: 188 - 228 (Roll no. 302).

action.text: House amendment offered/reported by: Amendment (A008) offered by Mr. Langevin.
House amendment not agreed to: On agreeing to the Langevin amendment Failed by recorded vote: 188 - 228 (Roll no. 302).
Roll call votes on amendments in House
Amendment failed in Committee of the Whole
